question: The term “Base Movement”, sometimes seen in news, is associated to:
option1: Indian government's initiative to fight extremism infected areas of Northeast
option2: newly formed terror group active in south India
option3: paramilitary forces action against the naxalites in Red Corridor area
option4: militant movement being carried out by insurgents and separatists in Jammu and Kashmir
answer: newly formed terror group active in south India
explanation: Base Movement is the newly formed little know terror group active in south India. It has extended its operations to Kerala from Tamil Nadu. Base Movement had suspected allegiance to Al Qaeda as the word ‘Al Qaeda” means base and the movement was said to be a South Indian outfit of Al Qaeda. This mysterious outfit has announced launch of its operations by sending letters and emails to various institutions in South India.
